title: Found
body:
<<nameTag Guards >>
Stop Right There!
<<nameTag Player >>
Oh no... I have to find a way to go around him.

title: Start_Prisoner_1
body:
<<nameTag Jeff>>
You have finally awakened.
<<nameTag Player>>
uh... Who am I?
<<nameTag Jeff >>
What!? Did you lose your memory?
<<nameTag Player>>
I can't remember all my past.
<<nameTag Jeff>>
Well, I can't help you with that. Try escaping, my friend.
<<nameTag Player>>
But... I'm a knight. Justice won't allow me to escape.
<<nameTag Jeff>>
screw Justice. This is Hell. Everyone is trying to escape.
<<nameTag Player>>
What should I do then?
<<nameTag Jeff>>
Try talking with her.

title: Books
body:
<<nameTag Book>>
Introduction:
<<nameTag Book>>
"In the heart of the medieval village of Eldershire, where dense forests whisper ancient secrets and rivers sing the songs of yore, lived a young boy with dreams of grandeur and adventure."

<<nameTag Player>>
Where is the rest of the pages?

title: Start_Elizabeth
body:
<<nameTag Player>>
Where am I? Who are you?
<<nameTag Elizabeth>>
You're in the depths of the castle, imprisoned like many who have crossed the wrong people. My name is Elizabeth. I’ve been down here longer than I care to remember.
<<nameTag Player>>
I can’t remember anything. My head... it feels like it's been split open. How did I get here?
<<nameTag Elizabeth>>
You were brought in unconscious. 
<<nameTag Player>>
What... How do I escape this place?
<<nameTag Elizabeth>>
Escape won’t be easy, but I believe you have a gift, one that even you might not realize yet. There are tales of knights with unique abilities, those who could turn their surroundings to their advantage.
<<nameTag Player>>
A gift? What kind of gift?
<<nameTag Elizabeth >>
I can’t say for sure. But look around you. The MOUSE might guide you. You might find you have the power to influence them in ways you never thought possible.
<<nameTag Player>>
Alright, I’ll keep that in mind. Thank you, Elizabeth.

title: Book_1
body:
<<nameTag Book>> 
Early Life and Training:
Born to humble farmers, this boy was instilled with the virtues of hard work and honesty. His days were spent tending to fields, but his heart yearned for the mysteries that lay beyond.

At the tender age of 12, fate led him to Sir Reginald, a knight of old, whose dwelling lay on the village's outskirts. The boy, driven by an insatiable curiosity and a yearning for valor, begged Sir Reginald to take him under his wing.

<<nameTag Player>> 
Ughhhh, I... I remembered...

Wait, Is that... me?

title: Book_2
body:
<<nameTag Book>> 
Rise to Knighthood:
Years passed, and the boy, now a young man, mastered the arts of combat and chivalry. His bravery shone in skirmishes against bandits, earning him the respect of Eldershire's people.

His moment of glory came when he saved the lord's daughter from a treacherous kidnapping. For this act of heroism, he was knighted and celebrated as a beacon of justice.

<<nameTag Player>>
Right! I remembered...

I saved my lord's daughter...

<<nameTag Player >>
But, Why am I at the Prison?

title: Book_3
body:
<<nameTag Book>>
A Mysterious Mission:
The knight's valor reached distant lands, and soon, a secretive summons arrived, calling him to aid a faraway kingdom. He set forth, braving perilous terrains and gathering loyal companions.

<<nameTag Player>>
...

title: Book_4
body:
<< nameTag Book>>
The Betrayal:
Yet, upon reaching the kingdom, treachery struck. Betrayed by a trusted ally, the knight was captured and imprisoned in the depths of a formidable castle, where darkness and danger loomed at every corner.

<< nameTag Player>>
RIGHT, I GOT BETRAYED...

title: Book_5
body:
<<nameTag Book>>
Loss of Memory and Current Predicament:
A fierce struggle left the knight gravely injured, and when he awoke, his mind was shrouded in fog. He found himself in a labyrinthine basement, filled with traps, puzzles, and the shadows of his past.
<<nameTag Player>>
Wait a minute, the book is telling my past!? 

<<nameTag Book>> 
Stripped of his memory, he must rely on instinct and skill to navigate this perilous maze, uncovering fragments of his identity and the truth behind his betrayal.

<<nameTag Player>>
Who wrote this book? How did they know my past and my situation.

title: End_Elizabeth
body:
<<nameTag Elizabeth>>
Remember Trust is a double-edged sword. Not all who seem like allies have pure intentions.

title: End_Prisoner_1
body:
<<nameTag Jeff>> 
The key to your past lies hidden in the depths of this castle. Search diligently, for every clue is a step closer to your true self.

title: ManaPotion
body:
<<nameTag Player >> 
Yeah, a mana potion, that will help me
(+10 Mana)

title: Hidden
body:
<< nameTag Player>>
Hm... That's weird, I can sense something under it.

title: Envelope_Hint
body:
<<nameTag Player >>
(opens the envelope and reads aloud)
"There are two paths in the maze: left and right."
"Left: You must think outside the room. It’s a test of wit and imagination, but it’s quite easy if you figure it out."
"Right: This path has no traps. It’s straightforward but take longer."

(suddenly notices the envelope heating up in his hand)
What the...?
(throws the burning envelope to the ground, watching as it completely disintegrates into ashes)
I guess that’s one way to keep secrets. Better get rid of this before it burns my hand.

title: Flag_Hint1
body:
<<nameTag Player >>
(opens the envelope and reads aloud)
1) Blue

title: Flag_Hint2
body:
<<nameTag Player >>
(opens the envelope and reads aloud)
2) Red

title: Flag_Hint3
body:
<<nameTag Player >>
(opens the envelope and reads aloud)
3) Yellow

title: Flag_Hint4
body:
<<nameTag Player >>
(opens the envelope and reads aloud)
4) Green

title: Start_Angel
body:
<< nameTag Player>>
Hello, who are you?
<< nameTag Angel>> 
I'm Angel. I've been wandering these halls for what feels like an eternity. I’ve seen many come and go, but few make it far. You, though, you seem different.
<< nameTag Player>>
I’m trying to escape this place. Can you help me?
<< nameTag Angel>> 
Perhaps. There’s a puzzle you must solve to progress further. It involves four flags. Each one can change color when interacted with.
<< nameTag Player>>
Four flags? What do I need to do with them?
<< nameTag Angel>> 
The key lies in getting the flags to display a specific color order. Once you have the right combination, a hidden chest will reveal itself.
<< nameTag Player>>
How do I know what the right order is?
<<nameTag Angel>>
Pay attention to the clues scattered around the room.
<<nameTag Player >>
Alright, thank you so much!

title: End_Angle
body:
<<nameTage Angle>>
Beware the shadows that lurk, for they hold the power to both reveal and deceive.
